awd_titl_txt: Measuring Income Momenta and Impulses for Managerial Goals  and Decisions
awd_abstract_narration: This research seeks to break new ground in accounting measurement of            managerial decisions by developing a triple entry accounting frame of           reference for bookkeeping, which links changes in the balance sheet and         in the income statement to management decisions so that a more long             term view of decision making will become prevalent.                                                                                                             This work could have a major impact on the dominant accounting                  paradigm.  The research will result in a system for measuring;                  recording and reporting income momenta and impulses of an enterprise;           apply its prototype in actual companies and analyze its impact on               managerial goals, risk taking and decisions.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Social and Economic Sciences
